alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 7:11PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Huerfano, Costilla and southeastern Conejos Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 711 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Garland to near San Acacio to 9 miles southeast of Manassa. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... San Luis around 725 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include San Pablo, southern Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Huerfano county, Sanchez Reservoir, Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, Jaroso, Mesita and Cuchara. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
